source.name: Chapter 1.2 - 7.1 rasa conversation flow
source.instructions: **Based on the conversation example, which of the following statements are true about how Rasa processes user messages? Select all that apply.**

answers.answer: The LLM understands user intent for all messages after the initial greeting
Level 1 responses use static messages defined in the domain file
Level 2 actions can execute custom Python code to generate dynamic responses
The pattern_session_start flow only triggers when users explicitly ask for help
FlowPolicy is responsible for matching user intents to appropriate flows
All flows must use custom actions to generate responses

source.learningObjectives: SWBAT identify which components are involved in processing different types of user requests in a Rasa conversation
source.guidance:
The correct answers are:

* The LLM understands user intent for all messages after the initial greeting - The conversation shows the LLM interpreting "What are your hours?", "What are your holiday hours?", and "How can I contact you?"
* Level 1 responses use static messages defined in the domain file - The contact flow uses utter_contact which provides a static response
* Level 2 actions can execute custom Python code to generate dynamic responses - Both action_bank_hours and action_holiday_hours execute Python code to check dates and generate contextual messages
* FlowPolicy is responsible for matching user intents to appropriate flows - The example shows FlowPolicy matching intents to hours, holiday_hours, and contact flows

The incorrect options are:
* pattern_session_start triggers automatically when a new session starts, not when users ask for help
* Not all flows require custom actions - the contact flow uses a simple utter response (Level 1)
